{"step_by_step_thinking": "Condylar fracture refers to a fracture of the condyle, which is the rounded portion at the end of the mandible (lower jaw). Dysarthrosis refers to a disturbance in the movement or function of the joint. In the case of a condylar fracture, dysarthrosis would typically refer to a disturbance of both the anatomy and function of the joint. This is because the fracture can disrupt the normal alignment and movement of the condyle, leading to both structural and functional issues.", "answer_choice": "B"}
